message.content:
cs.DS, cs.CG, cs.CC, cs.GT, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with optimization problems on graphs, specifically the graph-constrained max-cut problem. This problem involves finding a subset of vertices that satisfies a certain graph-based constraint and maximizes the weight of edges in the cut. This falls under the category of graph algorithms and optimization, which is covered by several sub-categories in arXiv CS. 

cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) is a likely sub-category as the paper proposes an algorithm for solving the problem. 

cs.CG (Computational Geometry) is also likely as the paper deals with optimization on graphs, which can be viewed as a type of geometric object. 

cs.CC (Computational Complexity) is another possible sub-category as the paper discusses the complexity of the problem and the approximation algorithm. 

cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory) is a possible sub-category as the paper deals with optimization problems on graphs, which can be viewed as games between different subsets of vertices. 

cs.LG (Machine Learning) is a less likely sub-category, but still possible as the paper uses an LP relaxation based on the Sherali-Adams hierarchy, which is a technique used in machine learning.
